title: [jit][script] indexing master task
body_html:
In order of priority:

  • Support multidimensional int indexing tensor[0, 1]
  • Support ast.ExtSlice in frontend
  • Support multidimensional slice/num indexing tensor[0, 1:2]
  • Support indexing on LHS tensor[0] = 1. This is hard because it is mutable and we don't support mutable ops yet.
  • Support advanced indexing tensor[index, 0] @zou3519
  • Support indexing with sequences tensor[[0, 1], 1] @zou3519
  • Support slices with ranges tensor[0:4:2]
  • Support ellipses tensor[..., 1]. There is a comment in the code that says this is py2 only but I think that comment is misplaced.
  • Support None indexing #12810
body_text:
In order of priority:

 Support multidimensional int indexing tensor[0, 1]
 Support ast.ExtSlice in frontend
 Support multidimensional slice/num indexing tensor[0, 1:2]
 Support indexing on LHS tensor[0] = 1. This is hard because it is mutable and we don't support mutable ops yet.
 Support advanced indexing tensor[index, 0] @zou3519
 Support indexing with sequences tensor[[0, 1], 1] @zou3519
 Support slices with ranges tensor[0:4:2]
 Support ellipses tensor[..., 1]. There is a comment in the code that says this is py2 only but I think that comment is misplaced.
 Support None indexing #12810
body:
In order of priority:
- [x] Support multidimensional int indexing `tensor[0, 1]`
- [x] Support ast.ExtSlice in frontend
- [x] Support multidimensional slice/num indexing `tensor[0, 1:2]`
- [ ] Support indexing on LHS `tensor[0] = 1`. This is hard because it is mutable and we don't support mutable ops yet.
- [ ] Support advanced indexing `tensor[index, 0]` @zou3519
- [ ] Support indexing with sequences `tensor[[0, 1], 1]` @zou3519
- [ ] Support slices with ranges `tensor[0:4:2]`
- [ ] Support ellipses `tensor[..., 1]`. There is a comment in the code that says this is py2 only but I think that comment is misplaced.
- [ ] Support None indexing #12810
